newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai bourse suspends Sanyo after fire.
newsitem.headline: Thai bourse suspends Sanyo after fire.

text.p: The Stock Exchange of Thailand (SET) on Wednesday further suspended trading in Sanyo Universal Electric Plc shares after it ordered a half-day halt on their activities in the morning.
The SET did not give reasons for its decision to further suspend Sanyo.

It said earlier that the bourse was waiting for company clarification on alleged arson at Sanyo's warehouse and head office on Tuesday night after a year-end bonus dispute between employees and management.
The SET later said in a subsequent statement that Sanyo's longer suspension was requested by the company itself on the ground that media reports on the fire could hurt its listed price.
Sanyo Universal closed 75.50 baht on Tuesday.
Sanyo told the bourse earlier on Wednesday that it was assessing damage from the fire which did not disrupt production of a wide range of electrical appliances at Sanyo factories in other locations.
It said Thailand's economic slowdown this year prompted Sanyo to trim annual bonuses for employees to a three-month average of their salaries against 5.75 months given a year ago.
Sanyo said property damaged by the fire had been insured.
Sanyo Universal, which employs about 7,000 staff and workers, is 30 percent owned by Sanyo Electric Co.
